intro: Picridium intermedium var. robustum, commonly known as the robust picrid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
